Authors:
Alina S. Puig, Roberto Ramos Sobrinho, Cory Von Keith, Noel
Thomas Kitchen, Osman Gutierrez, Ricardo Goenaga, Judith K. Brown
Title:
First report of Cacao mild mosaic virus (CaMMV) associated
with symptomatic commercial cacao (Theobroma cacao L.) trees in Puerto
Rico
Abstract:
This is the first report of Cacao mild mosaic virus
(CaMMV) associated with commercial cacao trees in Puerto Rico, USA. If
found to be detrimental to the yield and/or quality of cocoa beans, the
virus could represent a potential new threat to cacao cultivation. This
discovery highlights the importance of implementing molecular diagnostic
assays and quarantine efforts to prevent the spread of badnaviruses.
Additional studies are needed to determine the distribution of CaMMV in
commercial fields in Puerto Rico and other cacao-growing areas in the
Americas.
